articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Trump aide Bolton met Turkey ambassador to discuss U.S. pastor: White House
articles.description: White House national security adviser John Bolton met on Monday with Turkey's ambassador to the United States to discuss Turkey's detention of American pastor Andrew Brunson, the White House said.

articles.author: Tricia Phillips
articles.title: Pensioners robbed of £46million by scammers in cruel phone con
articles.description: Around 3,000 have been affected, with some even forced into bankruptcy by scammers

articles.author: Mike Allen
articles.title: Axios PM
articles.description: Mike Allen's afternoon take on the most important news of the day

articles.author: Betsy Klein, CNN
articles.title: Trump signs McCain defense measure, doesn't thank McCain
articles.description: President Donald Trump thanked multiple members of Congress involved in passing the John S. McCain National Defense Authorization Act at a signing ceremony at Fort Drum, New York, Monday, with one major exception: the senator for whom the bill is named.

articles.author: Bob Ortega, CNN Investigates
articles.title: Senators ask DHS to enforce immigrant detainee labor standards
articles.description: Six US senators asked DHS's Kirstjen Nielsen to increase oversight after CNN reported allegations of coerced labor in for-profit ICE detention centers.

articles.author: CBC News
articles.title: Suspected Golden State Killer now faces 13 murder charges | CBC News
articles.description: Prosecutors in California added another murder charge against a former police officer accused of killing 13 people throughout the 1970s and 80s.

articles.author: CBC News
articles.title: Ottawa deploys 200 troops to B.C. to help with wildfire fight | CBC News
articles.description: British Columbia formally asked the federal government for assistance after more than 3,000 people were ordered to leave their homes in another destructive season of wildfires.

articles.author: brian wang
articles.title: europe

articles.author: Kristin Romey
articles.title: The Grisly 'Origin Story' Behind the Perseid Meteor Shower
articles.description: The celestial phenomenon was identified long before astronomers took note by devout Christians, who had their own fiery interpretation.

articles.author: Sarah Gibbens
articles.title: Humans Cause Over 95 Percent of California Wildfires
articles.description: High crimes and celebrations are a few of the ways that residents have sparked a blaze.

articles.author: Eric Niiler
articles.title: Why Gene Editing Is the Next Food Revolution
articles.description: Crispr has the potential to boost yields, disease resistance, and taste, and even tackle allergens like gluten. It could radically change how we breed and grow crops—and scientists say they're working only with nature's tools.

articles.author: Simon Worrall
articles.title: How Killer Whales Went from Hated, to Adored, to Endangered
articles.description: The more we’ve learned about orcas, the more we love them. But can killer whales survive the dramatic changes to their world?

articles.author: Andrew Fazekas
articles.title: How to See the 2018 Perseid Meteor Shower
articles.description: Anticipation is high for this year’s sky show, which peaks over a moonless weekend with projected rates of 90 to 120 meteors an hour.

articles.author: Nadia Drake
articles.title: NASA Sets Out to 'Touch the Sun'—Here's How
articles.description: By boldly going where no spacecraft has gone before, the Parker Solar Probe will attempt to solve big mysteries about our nearest star.

articles.author: Lori Cuthbert, Douglas Main
articles.title: Orca Mother Drops Calf, After Unprecedented 17 Days of Mourning
articles.description: A Pacific Northwest orca likely bonded closely with her calf before it died, which could help explain her record-breaking emotional sojourn.

articles.author: Sebastian Junger
articles.title: See How Soldiers Sleep in the Field
articles.description: While embedded with U.S. troops in Afghanistan, photographer Tim Hetherington created images showing rare and precious moments of calm.

articles.author: Michael Greshko
articles.title: Early Native Americans Imported Exotic Parrots, DNA Reveals
articles.description: The discovery suggests that scarlet macaws were being bred for trade centuries earlier than previously thought.

articles.author: Lane Nieset
articles.title: How Scotland Is Bringing Back Its Lost Alcohol
articles.description: With many Scotch distilleries closed or forgotten, whisky makers look to the past to rethink the country's heritage spirit.

articles.author: Brett Samuels
articles.title: Farragut West Metro station closed after reported bomb threat
articles.description: Metro trains in the heart of downtown Washington, D.C., are bypassing Farragut West Station due to a "police investigation," the Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority (WMATA) announced Monday.

articles.author: Shireen Khalil
articles.title: Donald Trump is a ‘gangster’
articles.description: THERE was a tense exchange between guests on the Q&A panel last night after one of them, radical Christian philosopher Cornel West, invoked fascist leaders Adolf Hitler and Benito Mussolini to criticise current US president Donald Trump.
